page.title: 01Land around Howgate Hill
page.content: This is a quiet peaceful area of grass covered rolling hills, cultivated fields, grazing animals and few inhabitants. The major features are Howgate Hill (444m) and part of the village or Rigside which is the only area of concentrated population. The and consists of hills covered in rough grass and fenced pasture land where large numbers of sheep and beef cattle are grazed.Crops of wheat, barley, oil seed rape are grown as well as grass for silage and hay. There are also area of young and newly planted conifers on Howgate Hill. The inhabitants either live on the two farms or part of the village of Rigside, which is now mainly inhabited by retired miners or those who commute. The village offers few amenities with only a few shops and a limited bus service
